result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey M Wills was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the $250.00 cash bond on file be applied to the fine and costs, leaving a balance of $455.00.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.
Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey M Wills

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from Clerk to Defendant re: Payment Arrangements
No Appearance by Defendant.  Defendant has made payment arrangements.  Court orders Warrant - stay pending compliance with Payment Plan

2:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement - will plea to count 1 and dismiss and read-in count 2, with a fine and costs.  State takes no position in regards to the credit.  Court questions Atty Wilsnack.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation. 

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on count 1.  Court orders count 2 be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  $200 fine plus court costs.  Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court orders the cash bond be applied to the fine and costs.

Court adjourned at 2:54 p.m.

3:32 p.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney Jon Wilsnack present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Wilsnack - have an agreement and request hearing ASAP.  Atty to schedule with the JA.

Court adjourned at 3:32 p.m.

10:35 a.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites plea agreement, defendant will plea to OWI-3rd offense.  DA concurs.  Atty Wilsnack concurs.  Defendant concurs.  Court questions counsel.  Statement by counsel - this agreement does not include 2015CM70.  Court sets 2015CM70 for status hearing on May 18, 2015 at 2:00 p.m.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to OWI - 3rd.  Court orders counts 2 & 3 be dismissed.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Wilsnack.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

45 days county jail, with huber to commence immediately
$600 fine plus costs
D.L. revocation for 24 months
IID  24 months
AODA

Court grants the defendant 60 days to pay or payment plan.

Court remands the defendant to the custody of the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

Court adjourned at 10:46 a.m.
Defendant is not to consume any alcohol.
Defendant is not to consume any alcohol.

1:48 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Jon Wilsnack.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Atty Wilsnack enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Atty Wilsnack requests bond be amended.  Court sets bond at $250.00 cash bond and conditions of:  Defendant is not to consume any alcohol.  Court will set for Plea & Sentencing on April 20, 2015 at 10:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 1:52 p.m.

Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  With the exception the Defendant may be in is his own tavern in Markesan known as Up The Street, for management purposes only.  He may not bartend or handle alcohol in his place of business.   
Defendant may deposit cash bond by the end of the business day tomorrow.

With the exception the Defendant may be in is his own tavern in Markesan known as Up The Street, for management purposes only.  He may not bartend or handle alcohol in his place of business.   
Defendant may deposit cash bond by the end of the business day tomorrow.

1:03 p.m.  Defendant present and in custody, without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant has received a copy of the criminal compliant.  Court finds probable cause.  Statement by DA.    DA makes bond recommendation.  Statement by Defendant.  Court sets bond at $250.00 cash bond and conditions of:   Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  With the exception the Defendant may be in is his own tavern in Markesan known as Up The Street, for management purposes only.  He may not bartend or handle alcohol in his place of business.   
Defendant may deposit cash bond by the end of the business day tomorrow.  Court will set for Intial Appearance Monday, March 30, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.
